thread.title: Dutko scores five touchdowns as Falcons net first win
thread.title_full: Dutko scores five touchdowns as Falcons net first win

title: Dutko scores five touchdowns as Falcons net first win
text: Dutko scores five touchdowns as Falcons net first win Area football from Friday   Writer Posted Oct. 17, 2015 at 1:39 AM Posted Oct. 17, 2015 at 1:39 AM Big Rock Flanagan-Cornell-Woodland waited eight weeks before coming out on the left side of the final score. Austin Dutko scored five touchdowns as the Falcons overwhelmed Crossroads Academy 43-6 Friday night for that first win of the season. Dutko rushed for 239 yards on 13 carries in leading the young and banged up FCW club. It was a game that also allowed for a number of players a chance to hit the field. Kyle Voytko added 67 yards on the ground and caught two passes for 26 yards. Brady Sember had two receptions for 45 yards and a TD and Chandler Hillebrenner threw for 71 yards and a touchdown. FCW scored in a variety of ways in this night. Dutko got the Falcons on the board with a 6-yard run and Hillebrenner connected with Sember for a 36-yard score. The defense got into the act when Bryce Welch recorded a safety. Dutko added scoring runs of 58, 9 and 55 yards before Crossroads got on the board. It didnâ€™t take long for the Falcons get that score back as Dutko raced 81 yards with the kickoff for a touchdown. FCW (1-7) will host Tremont in its season finale next Friday. GCMS 52, Fieldcrest 0 At Gibson City, the host Falcons showed they might be the best team in the Heart of Illinois Conference with a 52-0 victory over Fieldcrest. GCMS led 32-0 at the half and scored its first touchdown in the third period on a fumble return. The GCMS defense was strong all night as it held FHS quarterback Drew Barth to just 88 yards through the air. Connor Kuehn rushed for 34 yards. IN OTHER ACTION , Prairie Central handled Eureka at Lewis Field to improve to 4-4 on the season.   Writer
